snippet: Joseph Romano, convicted for a fraud that prosecutors say exceeded $40 million, is accused of plotting the murder of the judge and the prosecutor in the case.
abstract: Federal court documents reveal that Nassau County Correctional Center inmate Joseph Romano, who is serving a 15-year sentence for fraud, sought to arrange murders of the federal judge and prosecutor he believed were responsible for putting him behind bars; Romano and his associate Dejvid Mirkovic are charged with conspiracy to murder and face up to life in prison if convicted.
lead_paragraph: Joseph Romano, convicted for a fraud that prosecutors say exceeded $40 million, is accused of plotting the murder of the judge and the prosecutor in the case.

headline.seo: Man Convicted in Fraud Is Accused of Seeking Judge’s Death
headline.main: U.S. Alleges Plot to Kill a Prosecutor and a Judge
headline.print_headline: U.S. Alleges Plot to Kill A Prosecutor And a Judge
